entry.title: Children Fed on Grass, No Medication for Rape Victims: Aid to African Crises Cut Back as Needs Soar
entry.content: Aid groups in Africa face the biggest funding shortfalls in decades amid new humanitarian emergencies, price increases and the Ukraine war.

entry.title: Slow-Boil Refugee Crisis Takes Toll Even in Germany
entry.content: The country received 322,000 asylum requests last year, second only to the much larger U.S., and is struggling to cope.

entry.title: As It Rebuilds From Floods, Vermont Plans for More Disasters
entry.content: Most water-damaged businesses in the state capital of Montpelier remain closed after a July deluge.

entry.title: A 1997 Motel Murder Puts a Convict's Life on the Line in the Supreme Court---Again
entry.content: Oklahoma’s Republican attorney general is pushing to throw out Richard Glossip’s conviction, but other state officials say enough is enough.
